column1: 2 ^ Dixit injústus ut delìnqŭat in semet ìpso~; non èst tìmor Dei ante òculos ejus. ^ The unjust hath declared within himself that he might sin~; there is no fear of God before his eyes.
3 ^ Qŭóniam dolóse egit in conspèctu ejus
column2: ut inveniátur iníqŭitas ejus ad ódium. ^ For in his sight he hath done deceitfully
column3: that his iniquity may be found unto hatred.

column1: 4 ^ Vèrba oris ejus iníqŭitas et dolus~; nóluit intellègere ut bène ágeret. ^ The words of his mouth are iniquity and guile~; he has not wished to understand that he might do well.
5 ^ iniqŭitátem meditátus èst in cubíli suo~; ástitit òmni viaĕ non bonaĕ
column2: malìtiam aŭtem non odívit. ^ He hath devised iniquity on his bed~; he hath set himself on every way that is not good
column3: but evil he hath not hated.
et vèritas tua usqŭe ad nubes. ^ O Lord
column5: and thy truth reacheth even to the clouds.

column1: 7 ^ Justìtia tua sicut mòntes Dei~; judìcia tua abìssus mùlta. Hòmines et jumènta salvábis
column2: Dòmine. ^ Thy justice is as the mountains of God~; thy judgments are a great deep. Men and beasts thou wilt preserve
Deus. Fílii aŭtem hòminum in tegìmine alárum tuárum sperábunt. ^ How hast thou multiplied thy mercy
column3: O God! But the children of men shall put their trust under the cover of thy wings.

column2: et torrènte voluptátis tuaĕ potábis eos. ^ They shall be inebriated with the plenty of thy house
column3: and thou shalt make them drink of the torrent of thy pleasure.

column1: 10 ^ Qŭóniam apud te èst fons vitaĕ
column2: et in lúmine tuo vǐdébimus lumen. ^ For with thee is the fountain of life
column3: and in thy light we shall see light.

column2: et justìtiam tuam hîs qŭi recto sùnt corde. ^ Extend thy mercy to them that know thee
column3: and thy justice to them that are right in heart.

column2: et manus peccatóris non móveat me. ^ Let not the foot of pride come to me
column3: and let not the hand of the sinner move me.

column1: 13 ^ Ìbi cecidérunt qŭi operántur iniqŭitátem~; expùlsi sùnt
column2: nec potuérunt stare. ^ There the workers of iniquity are fallen
